Get and Cache KEGG Pathway Data

Source: R/getkeggdata.R
getkeggdata.Rd

Retrieves pathway data from KEGG and caches it for enrichment analysis. This function automatically handles caching to reduce repeated KEGG API calls.

getkeggdata(species, cache_dir)

Arguments

species

KEGG species code (e.g., "hsa" for Homo sapiens, "dre" for zebrafish)

cache_dir

Directory for caching the downloaded data

Value

A list containing three elements:

pathways

Named vector mapping pathway IDs to pathway names (e.g. list("hsa00010" = "Glycolysis"))

pathscpds

List mapping pathway IDs to vectors of compound IDs (e.g. list("hsa00010" = c("C00022", "C00031")))

compounds

Named list mapping compound IDs to compound names (e.g. list("C00022" = "Pyruvate; Pyruvic acid"))

Details

The function performs the following steps:

  1. Checks for existing cache in cache_dir

  2. If cached data exists, loads and returns it

  3. If no cache, queries KEGG API for:

    • All pathways for the species

    • Compounds in each pathway

    • Compound name mappings

  4. Saves results to cache for future use

Note

Compound names are returned as semicolon-separated strings containing all known synonyms. API queries may take 2-5 minutes for species with many pathways (e.g., human has 400+ pathways).

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Get pathway data for human
kegg_data <- getkeggdata("hsa", cache_dir = "./kegg_cache")

# Access glycolysis compounds
glycolysis_cpds <- kegg_data$pathscpds$hsa00010

# Get pyruvate names
kegg_data$compounds$C00022
# Returns: "Pyruvate; Pyruvic acid; 2-Oxopropanoate; ..."
} # }
